nodes.bodyText: Worth adding VideoConstants.* them as static import

yes it's what i did in the past until the Glacier developments that I did where Florent asked me to avoid the  static import and use them really for the known things (like StringUtils for example). His idea is to simply the class reading. :)
but if we all agree i will update it
I took your suggestion about the static import, but i keep the conversion open for more feedbacks.
same suggestion than here
When I mentioned avoiding static imports I was talking mostly about methods, not constants.
Why do you need to deploy it?

the last @Deploy("org.nuxeo.ecm.platform.video.core:video-configuration-override.xml") is needed to have the storyboard (because storyboard check on the duration here and I don't want to test with a big video, the contribution:
<storyboardMinDuration>0</storyboardMinDuration> which suits my need
for the the two others please see comment my idea is to ensure that disabling conversion is done by my flag and not because we don't have the required contributions
Worth adding some comments, such as we check that the conversion done event is not fired as we don't do any conversion.

Be consistent :)
noStoryboard and noTranscodedVideos or just storyboard and transcodedVideo (my peer).
Is this really needed? The case with false aka not existing is tested in testVideoConversions.

yes i agree that this part is already covered by the other test, i just added to be test that disabling thing will recompute what it is needed.  and for more context with the second part I am sure that the No conversions is ensured by my new flag, because if for example I remove the     @Deploy("org.nuxeo.ecm.platform.video.core:video-configuration-override.xml") the storyboard will not be computed not because of my flag but because of missing the contribution. it is my second assertion that allows me to see that I need the contribution to avoid any false positive.
Why a log.trace here, but not in VideoChangedListener?

good point, for the video initially I sa what we have on the picture one, this the reason why i avoid the log. for thumbnail i added for debugging purpose and i forgot to re-put the same thing on Video. I think it's better to have the log. wdyt
Log added too for video
The thumbnail generation is already tested before.

yes i agree, as explained above i just keep the same thing (check the same document to avoid any false positive cases):
disabling -> no thumbnail, no conversion
re-enabling-> thumbnail, conversion
Done for this case :)
already done before I see you review :) thx
FYI @since is overkill for protected/private fields/methods
